bow: the unnatural mom wow really liked this read currently 25 weeks pregnant and of the you should do whatever makes you happy camp when it comes to being pregnant and delivering baby for my first pregnancy birth was planner oh had plans but those plans were eventually demolished now non planner my birth plan for this baby going to eventually have baby how that happens will depend on what happens wo make plans in advance going to totally wing it me just completely looking forward to delivering baby that does require life support for months so excited read this article and felt so bad for this mom sometimes wonder what it would have been like if my daughter had been so sick would have felt guilty heck felt so guilty when she was horridly sick because just could produce breast milk all of the consultants talked to told me that if just tried hard enough would make milk lol for me thinking back the natural parenting method is just so completely nothing could have ever ever done my first year of parenting was all hospitals surgeries ventilators and feeding tubes nothing about my parenting experience was natural but that does mean was more or less of parent than anyone else for this baby feel like it will be so simple but who knows my plan for being parent involves caring for and loving my child what type of diapers choose whether breast or formula feed what type of laundry detergent use is all moot completely moot had natural birth with my first it was overrated people need to get over themselves if that the choice they make to have painkiller free birth in tub of their own fluids that fine but it does make them stronger braver tougher or better than moms who choose wind up having different births what matters is that you and your baby are okay also all birth is natural there nothing more natural than giving birth and there also nothing more natural than wanting to escape the pain either thanks for sharing this felt horrible guilt when everything did work out the natural way the first few days was wreck feeling like failed as mother already everyone should read this before their baby is born and maybe it would spare some people some heart ache had an unplanned section in june too do feel guilty about the section bummed yes but it *her* that decided to kick her sack open while breech the stinker but do feel pretty down over supplementing with formula and disappointed could con my husband into cloth diapers but mostly because cheap just do get why it has to be competition so what if you re natural or not do some things very natural and other things not even close honestly do care if someone had or drug free at home birth you both made it out okay that all that matters people get way to worked up with comparisions love this have had so many friends who have felt like failures because they could breast feed or gave in to having an epidural and have been berated because you know people suck and on and on agree with taratlc you need to do what makes you happy with your birth mothering things whether you are the kind of person who is more comfortable with everything being planned out babies do always care about your plans when they are coming out or someone who insists that everything you feed your child is organic do think it means that person is better parent my daughter was 19 and terrified her father was in afghanistan and was supposed to be back before she was born mid september she decided that she was impatient and wanted out at the end of july and spent 2wks in the nicu she actually got out of the hospital the day before her dad came home my son thought had it all planned out was going to have an epidural because am admittedly huge wuss about anticipating pain then my doc told me that could be induced around my due date decided wanted to be induced and my son was supposed to be born on my sisters birthday the night before we were going to go to the hospital took shower with my daughter and shaved my legs woo 40wks and shaving my own legs my mother came up to stay with my daughter during the day my mom had been at the house about 15min and my daughter was in bed and my water broke apparently had been in labor all damn day and had no pain 20 min after my water broke with no epidural and crowning on the way to the hospital my son was born did even get fully checked in because the nurse went to check how far was dilated and called for towels because she had to catch him yeah babies do come according to any plan but their own sorry digressed it just really aggitates me when one mom passes judgement on another because she does something they did do with their snowflake so she had an epidural so she uses formula as long as that child is healthy loved and not being abused it is not anybodies business happy moms make for happy families do see anything natural about laying on table full of anesthesia while surgeon cuts my child out of my abdomen is that the point of this article quit trying to rope wholly artificial things into the natural camp just to be able to say you did it naturally and just own the truth formula is unnatural epidurals are unnatural cesareans are unnatural some of us do things the unnatural way because it the way we need to do them it okay to be unnatural do want to wash cloth diapers or make dish detergent cool do have been living such lifestyle for years before having baby and not once had ever met anyone else who would even consider making dish detergent until became mom suddenly if you re not making pinterest recipes you re deliberately poisoning everyone fuck it refuse to be around these judgmental asshats and forgot they exist until read this article these fads will fade and people will return to their old habits and favorite brands the best will forever change and what youre doing for your baby now will be the blueprint of what not to do 30 years from now think it bullshit that those who successfully make the sacrifices to have those natural unmedicated births and breastfeed for 12+ months are allowed to be proud of themselves because it makes you feel bad grow up they earned those badges of honor and you ll earn your own on this wonderful motherhood experience people care too much about what other people are doing all birth is natural and you do whatever works for you and your family relate to the article because even though had drug free birth and breastfed into toddlerhood and wore my babies and used cloth diapers realized pretty quickly that the attachment parenting ideal was setting me up to fail of course was going to be unable to get anything done if tried to hold the baby all day and when started going insane from sleep deprivation waited months until nearly killed myself from wandering out into traffic from misinterpreting traffic signals in sleepy haze to do cio will do cio much sooner with future children and wo feel bad find the formula breastfeeding debate insane because by the time they are toddlers we mostly all feed them granola bars and cookies and juice boxes at least once in while it the rare year old who is gulping down kombucha while nibbling on solely crackers made from sprouted grains and eating organic everything and wash my cloth diapers with tide there said it swore would always be loving and responsive but sometimes holler at my kids to stop fighting this very instant or putting you all in box and mailing you to grandma fwiw find the polarizing attitudes much more prevalent online irl in my own experience anyways most moms understand that things do always go according to plan and no one judges anyone else on how they gave birth or what their baby eats also found that was far more blindsided by my lack of instant bonding than anything else feel as though the mom in this article was in some ways luckier than was she had csection but still fell head over heels in no time flat spent few weeks staring at my newborn feeling like stolen him and waiting for the fireworks and violins that everyone told me would happen when first laid eyes on him it happened but it took time felt unnatural because what kind of mother looks at their screaming baby and wants to give them back what kind of mother sometimes wishes she had had baby so she could just get some sleep what kind of mother worries that she will accidentally get the baby and the garbage mixed up and throws the wrong one down the chute had some postpartum anxiety anyways it all resolved itself in time but felt lonely in my new parenthood and unnatural for those reasons worried never get the hang of things did but felt so ashamed of these feelings that never voiced them to anyone because motherhood and all the things surrounding new motherhood are held up on such pedestal in our society we need to bring it back down to earth this reminds of the latest parenting method ctfd http www thedaddycomplex com post 55268573331 latest parenting trend the ctfd method do know what it like to be person who seriously subscribed to much of any philosophy pregnant do smoke do drink but sure ll have little coffee going into labor *like* to avoid section but let do whatever necessary to get healthy baby out breastfeeding okay sure it best for the baby breastfeeding not going well let try something else except in that situation was that calm admit suffered lot of guilt the first time around when for three weeks did get any sleep she was clusterfeeding it was coming out on one side was *so* committed to breastfeeding that every little ache or pain or cry from her made me feel like was losing at being proper mother the second time around already had formula on hand at the house had decided for certain if was even going to try to breastfeed know this is popular idea but it what did and guess what that weight the pressure to ebf that feeling that just had to do it was gone and was able to nurse my baby enjoyed it was relaxed about it she latched on we had tender moments together in the mornings when everyone else was still sleeping and could feed her without feeling angry or resentful because knew there were other options just in case think if we can try not to build up all of these ideas about how we *have* to perform as superparents we might just have slightly easier time getting through the truly challenging stuff do know if this hardcore parenting philosophy stuff has been going on for while or if it just recently that people have as it seems to me anyway *obsessed* over how they classify themselves just know that it seems as though the more pressure we put on ourselves to fit into all these specifics with all these rules and regulations the worse we feel when one of those things does really fit thank you for your honesty had difficult time bonding with my firstborn and felt like horrible mother for not even wanting to touch her you re right the bonding happens but at different times for different moms now can not even
